content.description: Start on large jug rail as for French Fry, but move to the right arete and ride it to the highest point of the boulder. Easy top out.
content.location: Rightmost arete of the Potato boulder. Starting on the same big shelf of Jugs as French Fry.

content.description: A nice short problem on the leftmost boulder split.  Start mid way up the rock up through some good holds through the topout. Finished as quickly as eating a tader tot.
content.location: Located in the middle of the left most boulder, with the starting holds about halfway up.

content.description: Start matched on the big edge at the bottom of the main face of the Potato Boulder, slightly left of the crack. Pull off the ground and make a right hand move up into the crack, follow the left hand up into the crack. Finish straight up using mainly the crack.
content.location: In the middle of the more overhanging face of the Potato Boulder, in between Gnocchi and Hash Browns. Bit of an eliminate, but uses cool holds going directly up the face.

content.description: A slightly painful problem going up only the slab portion of the middle climb using a hand jam instead of the other two side boulder aretes.
content.location: Located on the same starting holds as Potato Potâto, but the left and right boulders are off.  Instead use a right hand jam and awkwardly bring yourself up into the rest of the middle boulder slab.

content.description: Similar region to Hash Brown, but the good side pull and right arete are off. Make your way up through the main face using only the individual holds.
content.location: Located on the main face of the right boulder with a similar start to Hash Brown. Work your way up the center using only the middle holds and not the left crack or right arete.

content.description: A variation climb in the middle of the boulder with an optional first move, eventually working its way up the middle through the topout.
content.location: Starts in the middle boulder on some low good holds.  Works it’s way either to the left or right boulder arete, eventually cutting back into the slab portion.

content.description: When you love potatos so much, but you don’t know what to do with it.  You then decide to just load it all into one dish and bake it.  This climb has it all traversing almost the entire boulder giving you all of the potato goodness you can ask for.
content.location: Starts at the same spot as French Fry on the right face of the right boulder.  Work your way up the slab and traverse into the main face of the right boulder (big blocks at the bottom of the main overhung face are off). Traverse through the main face into the slav of the middle boulder and topout through there (have a potato waiting at the top for celebration).

content.description: A slightly more traversey version of Tader Tot, mashed potato works it’s way from the right side to the left side of the smaller boulder, including slightly tougher holds.
content.location: Located on the right side of the left most boulder, starting on the lower crimp rail, traversing left through the topout.

content.description: Another easier climb, working it’s way up the arete of the smaller boulder through the topout.
content.location: Located on the right arete of the left most boulder split.

content.description: A fun problem working your way up a good side pull rail and the right arete.  Make your way into some subpar holds and topout through the middle  of the main face.
content.location: Located in the middle of the right most boulder. Start on the lower crimp sidepull and the right arete, eventually slapping your way up through the topout.

content.description: Works it’s way up another arete, staying only on the right boulder.
content.location: Located on some good low holds on the left arete of the right boulder.  Continue up the arete into the topout.

content.description: A slab climb starting with big blocky holds eventually traversing slightly left, topping out in the corner of the boulder.
content.location: Begins on the right face (facing the Egg Boulder) of the right boulder. Goes up a slab traversing to the left toward the peak of the overhang.

content.description: Are you hungry for some boulders? Why just stop after climbing some tomato’s when you can go a little deeper into the woods and climb a potato. This hot startchy specialty is a nice three way split rock with a good selection of low to mid range climbs.
